column1: #Text=—On Thursday morning it was discovered that three prisoners h .d broken Out of York Castle during the night.

#Text=Their names are, James Coates, 38 years of formerly of Leeds, five feet sever, or eight inches high, brown hair, grey eyes, pale complexion, by trade a joiner and cartwright, person small, thin face, with a wound on the elbow joint of his right arm.
#Text=Was convicted of larceny at York Summer Assizes, July, 1835, and sentenced to be transported for seven years.
#Text=Coates has, during the last three years, acted as hangman.
#Text=Marshall, late of Ripon* 37 years of age. about five feet six and a-half inches high", brown hair, grey eyes, pale complexion, by trade a shoemaker.
